storyInfo: As if waking from a dream, Saga finally looks upon the true face of 'Dusk' at the end of her decade of travel through the scroll.

attributes.text: A mind as still as water.
'Tis a rare trait for someone of thy age.
Thou hast extinguished all light and purged all emotions from thy mind, and thus are all creations of nature leaving thy body.
At long last, the still waters in thy mind give rise to new emotions—

attributes.content: Master storyteller! Pray forgive my interruption!
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Awake from your dream at long last... How long has it been?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: I have seen the plums blossom and wither ten times.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: As long as my ink brush remain untouched, the scenery in the painting would never change.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: To tell the truth, I had been counting ever since the moment I entered the painting scroll of Mount Sky. 'Twas indeed that long.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: ...Ten years?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: You stayed in the painting for ten years?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: More or less.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: You, a mere wandering monk, fiddled away ten full years here. What drove you to partake in such meaningless tribulations?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Well, I could enjoy a good sleep, partake in all manner of indulgences, and I need not be disturbed by the world, to say nothing of the Catastrophes and infections. I thought it a rather pleasant experience.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Be that as it may, you dreamt... for ten full years.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Few are capable of remembering who they truly are after such a long time. Some would forget who they once were and choose to forever remain inside the painting.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: My, how frightening.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Yet you are not afraid at all.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: You are a kind man. I verily believe you would wake them before they cross that point of no return.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Oh? What makes you say that?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: The old fisher at the summit of Mount Sky, the weaver by the banks of the Pu-kuei River, the halberd wielder of the Wu-chieh Plains, the lady innkeeper of the Lungmen Inn... and now the storyteller of the P'o-shan Village... Thou hast reminded me countless of times.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Yet I chose to deceive myself and continued to indulge in my pleasures, never to wake from my dream. I suppose I must apologize. It must have been tedious to keep me alive in the painting.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Pray be at ease. You came to the mountain when the autumn winds were yet blowing. 'Tis merely the beginning of winter now. It was but a brief dream.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Hoh! I was worried I would be reprimanded for my sluggish behavior. Little did I know it was but a brief period of time. That certainly puts me at ease.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: You already knew of your predicament when you reached Mount Sky, that it was merely a painting. Why waste your time?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: For I saw the truth of Dusk Beauty Flying to the Moon, and I could not well cease thinking about it... A madwoman took matters into her hands and sought to reclaim her true love from the heavens. 'Tis an act of pure lunacy, yet it overwhelms me with a sense of regret...
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Hmm... What if I tell you Dusk Beauty's willpower was an addition I made to the painting—that it is of my own making?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: All the nations of this world possess a great many legends, classics, literature, and myths, many of which can be called fabricated. The common folk are not likely to ever experience the machinations written therein. Should we disregard their lessons because they are mere fiction?
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: I think 'tis absurd to do so.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: You are a strange one.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: There is but a fine line between great and strange. I appreciate your compliment.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: ...Hah.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: You are just like your master. He's old, yet he has the heart of a child, a clear mind.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: You've helped me pass the time... Out of respect for your master, very well, I shall grant you an audience with me.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Um, an audience?
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Haha, you cannot possibly believe you've awakened by waltzing in here?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: *gasp*...! Am I yet within the painting?
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: No need to feel ashamed. This is merely how it's meant to be.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: If I let you break out merely because you wished so, it would blemish my image.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Well, now.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Wake up—
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Finally awake?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Ah...
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Get up now. It's terrible manners to sleep on the ground.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Oh...! You are right...
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: What's wrong?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Well... 'Tis merely that I never imagined you... to look like this.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Heh.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Well, ask away.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: I thought that by surveying the sceneries of these hundred-and-some scrolls, I, too, could walk the journey that thou once walked. Yet... 'Twas but an insignificant fraction of the landscapes thou hast sketched...
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Know that there are those who never accept their mistakes and find themselves content with dying here.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: That I can understand...
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: That's not what you wanted to ask.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Oh, right, I was startled into forgetfulness. My apologies.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Master, I have once laid my eyes upon the 'Scene of Crude Mounts Utmost Risen' at my head priest's garret. Though at the time I thought there was meaning hidden therein, I could not quite put my finger on it.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: I asked the head priest, and he had me leave the monastery to seek out the answer. I have since traveled all over the lands, and though I have since found parts of the answer myself, the ways of the world has me yet confused.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Since I am blessed with the fortune to meet thee in thy flesh, I thought I would—
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: If you've had your ideas, why ask me?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: I wish merely to learn from thy explanation for my own betterment and to fill in the blanks... To tell the truth, the painting's true meaning eludes me still. Pray tell, wherefore was the end of the waterfall just one swift stroke, leaving naught but a swath of emptiness?
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: What do you think?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: —Crude mounts utmost risen. The scenery within the scroll extends endlessly. The waterfall soars into the skies, leaving naught but white. 'Tis a way to depict the great mountains and rivers undepictable within the scroll...
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Hrm... This is merely conjecture. I am hoping you could do away with the secrecy and reveal the truth. 'Tis making me blush.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Beauty, especially that of an art piece, is in the eye of the beholder. It falls on you to find your own interpretation.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Nonetheless... You racked your brains so for only that?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Much of what we do in life is seeking answers.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: If not for this matter gnawing at my mind, I would not have had the fortune to feast my eyes upon thy landscapes within the scrolls.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: I suppose so.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Alas, the stroke you are asking was one that I began at whim and also one that I ended at whim. That's all.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: By the time I got to the waterfall, I no longer wanted to continue, and so I stopped there. I took a look afterwards and thought it was rather picturesque, so I gave it a name and sent it your master's way.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: I—
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: —I could never have imagined!
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Disappointed?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Having spent such a long time in the painting, and you ended up with quite possibly the most boring answer—
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Not at all. Leaving aside all that I have learned inside the scroll, thy answer is most interesting!
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Drawn on a whim, and stopped on a whim... I once thought that there is meaning to all things upon this world. As time passed, I became far too entrenched in my search, unable to pluck myself out.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Right, right. We need not be so focused on the meaning behind everything... If there is but one answer, to repeatedly scrutinize would merely be a futile exercise.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: I had heard from my master an aphorism: 'Where there was naught at first, from whence could dust have emerged.' Mayhaps it means the same thing?
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: ...Hah.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Everyone has their own interpretations. As long as you understand that, it's not necessarily a bad thing to be cocky.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Oh, I shall keep that in mind. Many thanks.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: When I gave your master this piece, I told him merely three words, 'Crude Mounts Utmost.' The 'Risen' in its name... is his interpretation.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: 'Risen?'
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Do you know what your master saw in it?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: He gazed not upon its landscapes with thee?
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: He didn't.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Hoh?!
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: A-Am I returning to the painting...?
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Oh, this must be what the head priest saw—
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Is that... my head priest?
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: That's right.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: He had scraped the soles of his feet, he was starving, and he walked three full days and nights of hunger.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: He prayed many times, as many as two thousand and a score, and yet he never thought a thing about his life and death. He merely felt sadness and lamented his inability to understand.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Did you save... my head priest?
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: I had already saved him once at the K'u-t'an River. I didn't help him this time.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Think about it. At his young age, he had already been through such hardships.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Think about how he went from that to the warm, caring head priest that you know.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: And how he added the word 'risen' to the painting's title.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Head Priest...
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.text: The lands he walked were filled with starvation.
All that he could see, hear, and tell were nothing but tragedy.
With each step, the young Higashi monk paused to recite the sutras.
Time passes like a flowing river, and this moment is everlasting.

attributes.content: On the day I left the monastery, my head priest bestowed upon me my name, Saga.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: That's right.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: He had seen the coldness of mankind, yet he was never disheartened. Even the collapse of Mount Sky did not sway him.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: After the young wandering monk made his way back to Higashi, he decided to take in a group of children with nowhere to turn to. He built a monastery in the mountains, and that's how he became the head priest you often speak of.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: It's not that uncommon of a story.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: The crude mounts had not fallen... That was the meaning the head priest sought to give the painting.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Very well! Then, in his stead, I shall see all the sights there are to see in this vast world!
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Well, as you please.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Now that you got that weight off your shoulders, it's time for you to leave.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: W-Wait, master!
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: This is merely the original source of my perplexity. Having traveled the scrolls some ten years, I am afraid there are certain things I must ascertain for my worries to dissipate.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Ask away.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: But know that this is the last chance I'm giving you. I'm not fond of blabbering people.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: The inhabitants of the paintings. Are they real or not?
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: That's an interesting question. You know they are from the painting. Why ask if they are real or not?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Oft did I nod off when we studied our scriptures, yet in my languidness I was able to constant seek out truth... For ten years have I walked the landscapes in thy painting, though I yet remain befuddled.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Pray tell, what is real?
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: ...Real.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: When we look at those who are unreal in the painting, as those who are real, we are able to laugh off all the fake lives and deaths depicted therein.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: But if we are yet inhabitants of a painting, and we will one day vanish into the thin air, would you still be able to remain so calm?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: All men will one day cease to be. There is little reason to be tormented by that which is inevitable. By approaching all things from the heart and living my life naturally and freely, there is naught to fear.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Man is not necessarily free. Everything that I've drawn, be it real or otherwise, is merely my way of interrogating myself.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Man is naturally free.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Wrong. Both you and I are habitants of a painting.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: You seek to solve this problem by yourself, yet you know not a thing about yourself. How do you mean to seek truth?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: In the end, what is real, and what is false? Are you sure you can truly tell them apart?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: And why take it so seriously?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: So thou meanst... I am yet within the painting right this moment?
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: ...You've truly left my scrolls, that I can assure you.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: I'm only asking, how do you prove that these landscapes before your eyes are not yet another boring painting scroll?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: The roads you've trodden, the people you've met, their births and deaths, and their setbacks in life. All of these things might merely be events drawn at the whim of an artist without any particular meaning assigned.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: The so-called reality that you people spend an entire lifetime looking for is yet another fantasy.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: We are merely characters in a scroll. The viewers see the events that transpire in the painting and either applaud or criticize its contents.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Our lives are but a fantasy, like a dewdrop or lightning, leaving not a trace in the end.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Let's stop here. You're wasting both your time and mine, and it's getting on my nerves.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: I will find a chance to pluck the other ones out. You should get going.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Lava came a long way solely for the chance to meet thee... yet thou wouldst not grant her an audience?
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: That's none of your business.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: You don't know why they came, so stay out of it.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: But—
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: —Don't push your luck, Saga.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: One more word, and I'll have you truly regret it.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: But I promised Lava to present this to thee, at the very least.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: You—This...?!
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Found you...!
attributes.name: Nian
